website_summaries.verdict: Specially designed to clean tarter from around the whole tooth.
pros: Each treat is designed to help the tooth penetrate the treat, helping it surround and clean the teeth
Added calcium and taurine are nice additions for cat health
Users note that the treats are also bigger than average, meaning cats must chew them before swallowing
This makes them much more effective
cons: Not recommended for kittens or cats weighing under 5 pounds

customer_reviews.title: Very tasty
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning my teeth has never been so delicious. I'm so glad I don't have to deal with bad tasting, burning toothpaste any more. Purina DentaLife Tasty Chicken not only satisfies my chicken cravings but also cleans my teeth with every bite. My cat really seems to like my breath afterwards as well. I just wish he wouldn't meow at me so much whenever I eat these. I think he really likes that I am taking care of my teeth because he never leaves my side from the moment I open the container until I finish eating the last bite. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TheDudeAbides

customer_reviews.title: Cat Crack
customer_reviews.text: My cat literally salivates so much when she know shes getting these. I'm afraid she's addicted. She sits, shakes your hand...she's a cat. I'm thinking Rehab might be next. I had to hide these from my mother since she was just feeding the cat so many, the cat lost her neck profile. Rehab is one thing, but gastric bypass is another. She down to four treats a day. She has her neck back and her teeth look great. The treats are crunchy and she has to really crunch on them a couple of times before she done, so they really do work on the teeth. Don't overfeed. Kitty Noneck is not cute.
customer_reviews.author: jkf

customer_reviews.title: Good size at just under a half inch.
customer_reviews.text: My cats just tried these today. They like them but they're not crazy for them. My older girl loves feline greenies so I'll stick with those for her. If you're wondering, as I was, how big the chunks are, they're slightly less than half an inch across. See photo for scale. This is big enough that my cats anyway chew them rather than swallowing them whole.
customer_reviews.author: SylvesterthekatTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Crunch, crunch, crunch --- clean teeth mean cheaper vet bills
customer_reviews.text: Both our cats love these. They get these and happily crunch away. Definitely do their job as neither cat has a breath that makes kitty face time something to dread. Teeth are clean and healthy. If you have a cat that never chews but simply gulps (like we once had) these probably won't do much. If they like to crunch like ours do now, they do a good job. I love it when they start that crunching. Must taste pretty good as they do lick up most of the crumbs at the end! (But I've never personally tested the taste, just in case you were wondering.)
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: She is 14 and her teeth are in perfect shape, whether because of the chews or not ...
customer_reviews.text: Out cat is simply addicted to these chews. I put one in her dry food (she gets dry and wet) and she goes right for it. If I don't put one in she meows at me, she really misses it. She is 14 and her teeth are in perfect shape, whether because of the chews or not I don't know but I'm not changing them. She would never forgive me.
customer_reviews.author: Liberteredo

customer_reviews.title: Cats love them
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these treats. For my Siamese cats, that’s really saying something. She’s very very picky and has a sensitive stomach. She handles these well and begs for them! I haven’t been to a vet appointment since I started using these to find out if they’re actually helping their teeth, but it takes them time to chew them which I’ve never seen with other treats. Usually, they inhale any treat they enjoy. So..if at the very least: my cats enjoy the treats. It takes them time to chew them. And you get a lot in a container-to me, that adds value and makes the money spent more well worth it. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: These work! Toss them across a hard floor instead of hand feeding
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that these would do much to tame my cat's horrible breath. Nothing like waking up in the morning to a nose full of stanky cat breath. If you have hard floors - THROW THESE. They're little balls, so they roll. It's a treat and a toy all in one. My cat goes absolutely bananas when we toss these across the floor, and they VASTLY improved his toxic breath. How could these possibly be any better?
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: It works like a charm to keep our cats teeth perfect.
customer_reviews.text: About 3 years ago someone recommended that to me for our cats after I had mentionedt that the Vet had said that we should think about having our older cats teeth cleaned and warned me that it would be expensive since the cat would have to be sedated. Well... two years later my Vet marvels at how clean both cats teeth look and it is all because of DENTALIFE....I give our cats 12 pieces as a treat every night... I am so pleased. IT REALLY WORKS. I know buy it for my cat loving friends for their cats too and they havev\ a treat like it for dogs too.
customer_reviews.author: Renate Ebsworth

customer_reviews.title: Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: Half of package is peanuts. My cat thankfully, is not allergic and nor are my kids. I had to separate peanuts from dental treats every time I gave it to my cat. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Mom3

customer_reviews.title: Nice big container full of Kitty Crack!
customer_reviews.text: I got a sample of these in a bag of cat food. My cat Lucy loves them. I toss one across the floor and she takes off after it like it's a mouse. I'll give her four of them a couple of times a day as part of our "routine" - first racing down the hall and then an excited race back and into the kitchen and back again. I'm not sure how well they clean her teeth but they make for a happy jaunt back and forth; a couple times a day. We'll be getting these again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: PSA-I LOVE THE AUTHENTIC VERSION OF THIS PRODUCT.  I’m not sure what went wrong :(
customer_reviews.text: My review is for the specific product I received. I love the authentic version & I have ordered it on amazon in the past without an issue so I’m not sure what went wrong :( the treats looked a little different than usual but I thought maybe the formula changed, after feeding a few to my cat he got very sick. I took him to the vet, he was fine but they couldn’t figure out what was wrong. Now I am so scared to ever order this on amazon again. Idk if this was an amazon thing, a Purina thing, or something in between. But it’s not ok & there should be better checks & consequences!!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Too hard for healthy adult cat to chew
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my healthy adult cats. One likes them alright - she can gnaw them down to where she can eat them. The other - loves any and all treats (or so I thought) tried to chew them the first few times I offered them but he couldn't break them. Nothing wrong with his teeth - the treats are too hard. Would return if it was worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: V. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: 7 cats...not one of them liked these...
customer_reviews.text: Was so hopeful after reading all the good reviews. One of my (treat loving) cats finally decided to give them a try. After chewing up 2 of them, most of it ended up on the rug (see video)...had to bring out vacuum. The others sniffed them and walked away. Thought these would be a great replacement for the round Tumblers that Temptations used to make (but discontinued for some unknown reason). Will have to give these to someone that perhaps has feral outdoor starving cats. Also says not good for cats under 5lbs (see pic of label)...maybe too big for small kitties. Guess it is a hit or miss...but zero out of 7...not so good for me.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Difficult for cat to eat
customer_reviews.text: I got these treats because one of my cats had to have a couple teeth removed last year, so I'm looking for ways to improve his oral health. I've been giving him Greenies, but these are cheaper, so I decided to try them. While he loves the flavor, he has a hard time eating these treats. I think they're too big for his mouth--and it could also be that chewing is more difficult for him now that he's lost a few teeth (but I've never noticed a problem with other food or treats). So I'll stick with Greenies for him and give these to my other two cats, who have no trouble eating them.
customer_reviews.author: Becky R.

customer_reviews.title: Your cat will beg for these
customer_reviews.text: Crunchy food is good for your pets' teeth. The scraping action as they chew cleans the teeth and works the gums. My 9-year old cat has shiny white teeth and always gets good checkup reviews from the vet. Most importantly, my cat loves these. Just follow the instructions on the package and remember that these are TREATS and NOT FOOD. Too many at one time and you will rob your cat of the nutrition it should be getting from its regular food. I hand them out one at a time and so 6-7 pieces at one session seems like plenty.
customer_reviews.author: Rixter

customer_reviews.title: Too big and dislikes smell and taste.
customer_reviews.text: She doesn't like it, but found out she dislikes Salmon completely no matter what it is. The pieces are too big as well and thick. Not good for Senior cats or smaller, small mouths. Cats can't chew. They need to crack the food and she can't fit this. Corn isn't digestible and it's the first ingredient. It's a filler and cats and dogs aren't supposed to eat corn. It causes Intestinal pain, gas and even diarrhea. Some are allergic to this. My veterinarian sad to not feed your animals anything that has corn in it.
customer_reviews.author: Incubus-Nihilist

customer_reviews.title: My Cat loves these!!
customer_reviews.text: My Cat enjoys these treats so much, he meows every morning until he gets them! He loves the favor, crunchiness, and smell. We have bought the Chicken and Salmon, he likes the Chicken, but LOVES the Salmon!! I bet your Cat will love these as much as mine does!
customer_reviews.author: Tmarz

customer_reviews.title: My cats love them
customer_reviews.text: I cant really say if they help my cats but they really like them and i rather give them these as treats than regular treats. I started my cats on these 3 months ago after i found both of my cats had some small teeth problems and had to have 2 teeth pulled each. The cats are 8 & 9 years old and never had issues before but i thought something like this would help.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: Kitties Love These Healthful Treats
customer_reviews.text: My kitties will almost fight each other to get to these treats. I like the idea they are getting a treat that is beneficial to their overall health, and I trust Purina. You can have your overpriced cat food and treats from so-called "premium" sources. A few years back when other pet foods had the problem with an ingredient that was causing kidney problems and deaths, Purina was the only company not involved with the tainted ingredient.
customer_reviews.author: Crawlinwithcats

customer_reviews.title: MY TWO FUR BALLS LOVE THEM
customer_reviews.text: I HAD A CAT THAT DIED BECAUSE I HAD HER TEETH CLEANED AND SHE GOT BLOOD SEPSIS. IT WAS MY FAULT, SHE WAS AN OLDER CAT AND I DIDN'T MAINTAIN HER TEETH. NOT ONE OF MY PROUDEST MOMENTS. I REALLY CAN'T AFFORD TO TAKE THEM TO THE VET FOR CLEANINGS SO I HAVE BEEN FEEDING THEM GREENIES AND NOW THESE. THEY SELL GREENIES AT THE VET SO I FEEL GOOD ABOUT THAT BUT AFTER FEEDING MY CATS DENTALIFE FOR THE FIRST TIME I COULD TELL THEY WERE HELPING. THEY ARE BIGGER PIECES AND YOU CAN HEAR THEM CRUNCHING DOWN ON BOTH SIDES. I WILL BE USING BOTH KINDS.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS BYLAND

customer_reviews.title: Addictive, motivating and effective--HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This product works. My 17 year-old cat's teeth are in much better condition after 4 containers. As for palatability, my elderly cat is driven to bushy-tail distraction by his desire for these "treats." The junior feline of the house (he's just turned one year old) hears "pee on the potty, get treat!" and bolts for the toilet to relieve himself (yes, those toilet-training inserts actually work) and then dashes to stand in front of the place the "treats" are stored (and where his elder is already waiting). This is an "always on hand" product for us now, and is the only "treat" our cats are given.
customer_reviews.author: one woman's opinion

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT DENTAL TREAT
customer_reviews.text: I have been giving these dental treats to my cat for several years. It has to taste good because Maci does tricks for them. When I get them out of the jar she listens to my instructions. She will sit and lay down. She is now 7 years old. Her vet is happy about her teeth. She was adopted by me when she was 2 1/2 and I’m not able to brush her teeth. These treats are thick and crunchy.
customer_reviews.author: Grammie LGL

customer_reviews.title: Cleans built up tarter.
customer_reviews.text: My cat’s vet said that he needed to clean her teeth in his office. I decided to try other options first. After 6 months, her vet said that her teeth were clean. He asked if I took her to another vet to have her teeth cleaned. I give her 10 pieces in the morning and 10 in the evening. She loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Boccignone

customer_reviews.title: "Salmon" flavor has chicken meal in it....
customer_reviews.text: My cats eat and enjoy these dental treats and they seem to do there job HOWEVER - I bought the salmon flavor because I have a cat with a chicken intolerance and was very dismayed to discover that the ingredients for the chicken and salmon flavors are virtually identical (Chicken flavor also has fish meal). As such I will not purchase this product again as I want dental treats I can safely feed to all of my cats.
customer_reviews.author: Ani M. Schjelderup

customer_reviews.title: Good for cats' teeth!
customer_reviews.text: Oh, my cat really loves these! She waits for me in the evening as she usually gets a few treats just before bed time. I like to shake the container as she comes running when she hears it. Nice crunching sound. I understand these are good for cats' teeth which is important to me. I choose food and treats carefully and try my best to take good care of my pets.
customer_reviews.author: MarleneLouiseTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Working great
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my 2 cats! I have one that inhales smaller treats and these force him to chew. I also have a cat that I rescued from the streets and unfortunately he has major dental issues. We have had them professionally cleaned and some teeth extracted. I have to brush his teeth several times a week and these treats are a wonderful supplement!
customer_reviews.author: loreleigal

customer_reviews.title: The Cat Seems To Like Them
customer_reviews.text: Most cats are pretty finicky, ours is no different. He will lean in for a sniff one day and turn his head and the next he's standing by the drawer asking for them. We call them 'tooth brushes' when we offer them so who knows but maybe his natural fear of the dentist kind of makes him 'go along with it' most of the time? (LOL) I think if the smell and flavor were truly amazing he'd want them more than once a day or take them any time they're offered. Clearly I wont be 'taste testing' them to figure it out for this review, LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Austin

customer_reviews.title: Uh-oh.... Who got to it first?
customer_reviews.text: The "kids" love this treat - over ALL others. This says "Chicken" flavor, but to me it smells like very good cheese. Whatever, they do love it, and as someone else suggested,... I toss a few all over the room so they have to go searching for the treats. Only problem is, these 3 siblings ALWAYS get along together. However, with these Dentalifes, there is sometimes a snarl or growl over ownership of the treat....who got to it first. Uh-0h!
customer_reviews.author: Hooked on Amazon!

customer_reviews.title: CONFESSIONS of a CAT OWNER!
customer_reviews.text: I MUST ADMIT .....I really wanted to know if it could scrape teeth?! So I TRIED IT and I must say the outer texture Has A Nice Scraping feel. NO DYES or ARTIFICIAL SPECIAL EFFECTS. It TASTES LIKE the FLAVOR ON THE PACKAGE when you CRUNCH THROUGH THE MIDDLE. I must say it is WELL WORTH THE MONEY and more. I have stopped buying other treats because THEY TASTE GREAT & MY CAT APPROVES!
customer_reviews.author: Mz.Bozz

customer_reviews.title: Swallows them whole = No dental benefit
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know how to rate these seeing as my cat just swallows them whole. So in a sense she loves them, is crazy about them, but isn't getting the dental benefits which is why I bought them. It isn't her normal behavior; she chews her dry kibbles which are a lot smaller than these treats. I wonder if they're just too hard to bite down on? I'll still keep offering them as treats but I'm going to have to seek an alternate dental cleaning treat (she deeply despises brushing).
customer_reviews.author: Greta M.

customer_reviews.title: Food Allergy?
customer_reviews.text: I didn't do a double blind study or anything but my 16-year-old cat has never been allergic to anything and suddenly had a severe food allergy after eating these for a couple weeks. I composted the remainder.
customer_reviews.author: N. Haugo

customer_reviews.title: Virutec Computer Repair Approved.
customer_reviews.text: I run a small computer repair store and only leave reviews on the things I feel meet expectations. I am giving this item a 5 star because It works great with no problems. We probably spend over $50,000 a year on Amazon for our business, so finding the right parts in a timely matter at an affordable price so I can make some profit is key. We rely on Amazon to keep us in stock with parts.
customer_reviews.author: Virutec Computer Repair

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVE these!
customer_reviews.text: My cats LOVE these treats. They beg for them all the time, even after I have told them over and over again"only 3 times a day".I have to hide them! My cats have strong, clean teeth and their breath smells better than it did before we got these treats. I would recommend for all cats. They also come in salmon flavor, which my kitties love just as much.
customer_reviews.author: Cass

customer_reviews.title: Good dental treats & vet approved
customer_reviews.text: I can’t rate taste myself, but both my cat’s like them and one even sits where I give them the treats and meows so I’m assuming the taste is good. Price is reasonable for the quantity received. I’ll also add that my vet said they are good and when I asked if they’d recommend they said “yes.” So....
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Cats love these treats and gives them good oral hygiene
customer_reviews.text: I'm assuming the flavor is good as my cats love these but I can't comment personally as my dentist would prefer I come in for a regular cleaning than to chew on these. Unfortunately sometimes my cats swallow these hole which defeats the purpose of giving them these treats for good oral hygiene. I've informed the cats that if they continue to do that that they will need to brush their own teeth, but they just look at me with a blank stare.
customer_reviews.author: Phillydog

customer_reviews.title: too big and hard
customer_reviews.text: These are a tad big and hard to chew for my cats. They take them sometimes, but often just roll them around in their mouths and try to bite them before giving up. If you decide to get these, I would buy a small bag to try and then move to the big container if desired. Of course, like mine, your cats may sense that you bought a boat load and even though they liked the small packet, the moment this is in the house and open, they stop eating it. Cats ... ya gotta love em.
customer_reviews.author: TCTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes it, but he doesn't have an account. So I buy it for him.
customer_reviews.author: W. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: 5 cats approve.  Worth the read!
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these a while ago and realized my error as there are SO many treats inside. I shared, which is what I do if I have too much of something. My boyfriend's cat, sister's cat, and my best friend's 2 cats. 5/6 of the cats loved them. My best friend's female cat snubbed it. 5/6 cats. The other cats loved it! When (or if) I ever run out, I'll purchse these again. :)
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: I think they changed to recipe or something
customer_reviews.text: My cat used to love these as a change from her favorites, so after buying 2 small bags, I got the big container. She no longer seems to like them at all- if she has no kibble in the dish she will come back and eat them, but there is no enthusiasm like she used to show. It’s disappointing because I liked that they were dental treats. Oh well- if she doesn’t finish this bunch, I’ll give them to someone in our local rescue who is fostering cats.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves them~
customer_reviews.text: I have an old cat who recently has had some bad breath. I saw these while looking for some treats, got them, and she loves them! She eats so fast and then throws up, so the vet suggested mixing dry food into the canned food. Now, I mix 4 pebbles in with her canned food morning and night, which helps to slow down her eating, and she hasn't thrown up since. It also gives her a change from the dry food. Great news all around.
customer_reviews.author: JUDY GREGORY

customer_reviews.title: I don't like them, but my cat does!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly can't stand these! They are hard and crunchy and quite honestly taste terrible! My cat, however, absolutely loves them. She seems to appreciate the teeth cleaning aspects and always goes for these first in the treat variety mix I provide for her. Happy, crunching and munching away, purring her thankfulness to me after eating said treat. What can I say, for some reason my cat likes these. I, on the other hand will never eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Wudmeister

customer_reviews.title: Happy kittens
customer_reviews.text: Simply, my cats love these! What else can I say... Don't know if it is helping their teeth. There is a lot of crunching! I would offer though, that the first few treat times, there was concern of choking. The large round size was unfamiliar to them. And their instinct was to get in their tummies rapidly. But due to the larger than normal treat size, it required more chewing before swallowing than their other treats. That said, they are quite skilled at it now, and no worries of improper chewing...
customer_reviews.author: TMS

customer_reviews.title: Hard as rocks
customer_reviews.text: My car could not chew theballs.We were afraid that they mightcausea ablockage. I even tred to break them with a hammer. Nope. I requested a return
customer_reviews.author: Whitebird

customer_reviews.title: Kitty loves them!
customer_reviews.text: On behalf of my kitty, I would say that she is pretty satisfied - although if she could choose, based on the way she inhales her other treats, she would prefer the ones that are not dental friendly. But that is just another good reason to give her dental friendly treats - I cannot imagine it is good for her digestion! But, that has not prevented her from demanding more! Either way, she loves her dry treats. She will not really touch other kinds of treats like canned food or shrimp. Kitty says thumbs/paws up to these treats...
customer_reviews.author: Cat S.

customer_reviews.title: Suitable for Large Cat
customer_reviews.text: I bought these cat treats as my cat is so large, he swallowed the greenies (cat treats) whole. The vet still recommended that he have some crunchy treats to help clean his teeth. These were the only ones I could find that were large enough that would ensure he had to actually crunch them. The cat likes them . And, although they are not VOHC approved, as our vet recommended, they seem to be working.
customer_reviews.author: I love books

customer_reviews.title: CAT LOVES THESE
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat that is SUPER picky and has never liked treats. He’s having issues with his teeth, so after getting them cleaned, I decided to try these to avoid having to clean them on a regular basis. Not sure if they help or not (it’s a long term thing) but WOW does he love these. He goes crazy for them! If you have a picky cat, or any cat, I highly recommend. Very affordable as well!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Fiebelman

customer_reviews.title: My cats won’t eat it
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats turned away from it after I opened the container and tried to hand her some. It doesn’t really have a strong smell and the balls are pretty big so the cats do need to chew which I guess cleans their teeth . My other cat will eat it eventually but only for breakfast when I’m not around to put out wet food. So I gave the rest to my sister-in-law’s cats.. they pretty much eat anything since they eat Meow Mix/Friskies. So this might not appeal to all cats. A shame since I thought I could simply give a treat to help clean my cats’ teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Executor

customer_reviews.title: Cats like them
customer_reviews.text: Our three male cats from the same litter all need their teeth cleaned every year due to propensity for gingivitis. Vets have recommended teeth cleaning treats. However, one of the cats has recently been diagnosed with early signs of kidney disease, and these treats are very high in protein so that particular cat can't have them. So, for me this a juggling act. We'll see if it helps the teeth on the cats that can eat these treats.
customer_reviews.author: ritaj

customer_reviews.title: These make my cats sick.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure at first, but after giving these to my cats after a week of not giving them any, they began throwing up again. Don't buy these if you care about your cats.
customer_reviews.author: Blane R. Schippers

customer_reviews.title: Don't have to wrestle the cat for dental care!
customer_reviews.text: l'm a three year old cat who just loves eating these! When l went to the vet recently, l heard the vet say that my teeth look great and had very little tarnish, in spite of never being cleaned. l'm so glad 'cuz l didn't want to get a shot and have my teeth scraped. Mom laughs when she gives these to us cats, because she says she can hear us chomping on them and its easy to understand how our teeth are getting scraped clean. So much more fun than brushing our teeth!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H.

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it and seem to take some time chewing on it, so I assume it’s doing some kind of cleaning on their teeth. Even my picky finicky eater cat likes it. Great value compared to the other dental treats. I don’t think it has any cleaning ingredient, seems like it’s just the shape and size doing the “scrubbing” thing, but still better than me trying to brush my cat’s teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn O'Shopper

customer_reviews.title: NO NO NO!!
customer_reviews.text: I got as an alternative to the very expensive Prescription Diet dental food I give my cats. These treats are so hard, my cats could not chew them. One of my cats actually choked on it I threw them out.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Salmon flavor. My cat loves these.  Glad that the expiration date was one year out.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a treat so my cat will sit still for me to apply a transdermal prescription. I keep a small amount in a non-see-through box, and store the rest in my pantry--dark, cool place recommended. To get my cat to come for her medication, all I have to do is shake the box and she comes running and jumps in my lamp. A 5 star winner for her!
customer_reviews.author: Mary G. from Stg.,CA

customer_reviews.title: Look at it this way, these are on my Subscribe and Save Subsciption
customer_reviews.text: My cats really like these and unlike several other brands these don't have corn starch which can stick to teeth, which kind of undoes the good that getting the cats to eat dental treats does. I've now gone 3 years without the necessity of getting the one cat's teeth cleaned which is a great improvement over the every other year that it had been.
customer_reviews.author: MAB

customer_reviews.title: good to roll & crunch
customer_reviews.text: Our cat is a little lazy, so to get her more active, I bought these and toss her 3 in succession in the morning. They roll really nicely on hard floors, so she gets her exercise... especially when she bats them with her paw accidentally and they roll even farther! I can't verify that they help her teeth because I'm not too sure of cat dentistry, but I know it takes her a few seconds to crunch through them and she does have relatively healthy dentition. Go ahead and purchase--help your fat cat exercise and (probably) help keep a healthy mouth!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Karolus

customer_reviews.title: First Treat my cat would not eat!
customer_reviews.text: Something about this product was not appetizing for my cat. He eats all kinds of other treats but not these. Guess I’ll see if the raccoons hitting my feeders at night will want them.
customer_reviews.author: Smokey Bear

customer_reviews.title: Even non-food-motivated cat goes crazy over!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I popped open the vacuum seal, my non-food-motivated cat went nuts, meowing and following me and crossing in front of me, too close to my feet so i nearly trip on him, all in an effort to, as I walked to his food bowl, make sure I didn’t forget to put some in his food bowl! Food doesn’t get a better reception than that!
customer_reviews.author: SLSoul

customer_reviews.title: She loves them ❤
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves ❤ these and they help keep her teeth clean. I've been giving her a couple each time she allows me to clip a claw, which is never easy. (It's a good day if I get 2-3 claws clipped.) Other times I will give her 5-6 total per day. The ingredients aren't the best, but the main goal was the teeth cleaning and use in rewards for good behavior.
customer_reviews.author: MunchkinsMomsez

customer_reviews.title: Cats love these
customer_reviews.text: my 2 cats have been on Greenies for years,and they they had gotten to there they didn't seem to enjoy them anymore,I found these and the reviews were better and apparently better for their dental care,and half the price.They absolutely love them in the chicken flavor.Sadly,I can't find them locally,so I just order them here,and I always receive them in 2-3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the purpose in which I bought them! Kitty cats approved!😻
customer_reviews.text: I have three cats and out of the three two of them have extremely bad breath. After giving them these for a couple days it has incredibly helped with their bad breath. They go crazy for them also. Good deal, Especially with prime\free shipping and the fact that I don't have to go anywhere to get them 👍🏻😊 thanks!... my cat's thank you too!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda P

customer_reviews.title: Cat enjoys these!!
customer_reviews.text: Every time I shake this, they come.. i guess my cat always does when he hears a container being shook. These and the Greenies are definitely his favorites. It's a great idea that these help "brush" their teeth while they enjoy the treats. That'll trick em! I noticed different prices at times from different vendors, be on a lookout for deals for these though. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Gobananas

customer_reviews.title: My cats Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I have to buy these online now because the stores don't seem to carry them anymore. They are a necessity for my kitties as our daily ritual is for me to throw the treats for them to chase. These are the only round shaped treats that I've found. The ball shape allows them to roll a long distance down the hall and across the room, even on carpet. The cats love a good chase! They like the taste too. The dental cleaning aspect is a definite bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea F.

customer_reviews.title: Cat seems to love them!
customer_reviews.text: Of the various treats on hand, these seem to be both the healthiest (in terms of number that can be recommended to be given on a single day) and largest. The porous structure does seem to mean more chewing on the part of my kitty, at least. Can't speak to the flavor, but my cat has filed no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: C. Callosa

customer_reviews.title: Great  Idea,  cats didn't agree
customer_reviews.text: My cats love, Friskies, and Friskies Crunchy Treats. However they ate around these, maybe its the size, or texture, wound up giving them to another cat owner. They did taste them before turning their noses away. which made them better than the other brands I tried in the past. also my cats are unique, they don't like moist food, and don't care when I make tuna fish.
customer_reviews.author: KPR

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this
customer_reviews.text: I have two 3 year old brothers. One already needed his teeth cleaned one has great teeth, so I decided to try this. I was already using Hills Oral food but chose this for their treats. They come running when I get out the jar so I know it’s a hit. Hopefully the next dental exam will be good for both my boys. They love both flavors
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats love them!
customer_reviews.text: I can always entice the cats into their safe room when I'm going out by giving them these treats. We'll see over time whether they help tarter down, because I don't see myself brushing their teeth!
customer_reviews.author: Elsie

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it & has healthy teeth
customer_reviews.text: The vet told us our cat might need a tooth cleaning that requires anesthesia. We started using these as a daily mid-day treat two years ago, and Kitty LOVES them. She leads us to the pantry each day at the same time to get them. The vet no longer has concern about her dental health. - About 20 +/- of these daily does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Buyer of ...

customer_reviews.title: My kitten loves 'em!
customer_reviews.text: I got these because they were well reviewed and far cheaper than picking up a 2.25 oz pouch of the Meow Mix dental bites at my local brick and mortar for $4. My kitten loves them! Since she's still a baby (11 weeks), she doesn't get anywhere close to the max of 17... instead, she gets 3-5 added to her kitten kibble every day. She certainly thinks they are tasty -- she usually picks them out to eat first. Not sure yet how effectively they clean her teeth, but I can definitely say she thinks they're nommy!
customer_reviews.author: Amy S.

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I took it out of the Amazon box and opened the lid, my cat went nuts wanting a treat! I've never seen her so adamant about getting a treat before. I handed one to my other cat and she became jealous. Beware of jealous cats. I can't speak for the tartar reduction at this time, but the flavour certainly works for them both. Will likely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: NSU demon

customer_reviews.title: they love these
customer_reviews.text: Years ago, they made these in a bag as dental diet dry food. All the cats in our families loved them. Then they discontinued them as dry cat food and now they are sold as "treats". At a much higher price. So I do not buy them often. But the cats come running when I get them out of the cupboard.
customer_reviews.author: Kimbo

customer_reviews.title: Kitty dental treats
customer_reviews.text: My cats are still young so I don’t know how well it works. But the 3 of them adore these. I’m glad they don’t come in a bag or they’d chew a hole in it for these things. They look like cereal & don’t have a strong scent. They’re actually pretty pleasant. I’ll be buying thes regularly from now on.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Our picky old female cat likes these
customer_reviews.text: 15 years old, grouchy and mean with grandkids. She will sniff and walk away from 9 of 10 treats placed in front of her. She is eating these! Our boy cat will eat 9 of 10 treats placed in front of him. The only one he has ever walked away from contained cranberry. Ain't that the berries...LOL.
customer_reviews.author: adrenaline junky

customer_reviews.title: I have two cats who come to get this as a treat, three nuggets at dawn and three at dusk.
customer_reviews.text: I did not taste them but the cats seem to like the flavor. They are fourteen years old and I have never seen anything they like better.
customer_reviews.author: Dan King

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and healthy cat treats!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few types of cat treats that not only do cats love them but they're healthy. Usually I make a blend of Dentalife, Blue Buffalo treats and Feline Greenies. All healthy & the kitties love the mix. I strongly recommend these treats for really anyone who has a cat or cats!
customer_reviews.author: ShadowstormsTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Cleo loves
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for our cat Cleo. She had some tartar build up on her teeth, the water additive didn't work to well so we purchased these. Wasn't sure if she would love them or not but she eats them down with no problem. She does crunch them and doesn't' swallow whole. Hopefully at her next dental check up she gets better results.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: My cat choked
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based on the good reviews and price...I wish I hadn’t.My adult cat has a hard time eating these-I have to cut them in half to prevent her from choking.They are not big in size...but I think it’s both the awkward shape and hard texture that give her problems.
customer_reviews.author: K. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Work well for tartar control.
customer_reviews.text: Great product with nutritious ingredients. My two picky cats loved the first bottle I bought. The 2nd bottle.. not so much. These are a little bulky and my cats are lazy and don’t want to work that hard for a treat! BUT, I added the 2nd bottle to another healthy & crunchy cat treat and just mixed them all together. They are eating them when mixed another treat. I DO see a difference in their tartar since they started using these. I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: FitBec

customer_reviews.title: 4 year old Cat had gum desease
customer_reviews.text: Back in March 2019, my 4 year old Cat had gum infection, the Vet wanted $490.00 , to clean his teeth, so ...I got him Antibiotics, and (I As I only feed Purina cat food, he (Gunther) wont eat anything else) Got him these Dental Treats , He Loves them and comes to eat them everyday, and his breath and gums have been fine since
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Our cats like these pretty good. I only give 3 or 4 each a couple times a week. They get other treats also. But these help with bad breath a lot, and I imagine help with dental hygiene too. Lasts pretty long for a lot of cats too. Great price, value , and does what it is supposed to without hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Bandit Loves them!
customer_reviews.text: If I let him, my cat would eat the whole canister in one sitting. That's how much he loves these. This is the reason why I get them every two months or so. He loves these just as much as he loves Greenies. But I can say one thing. His teeth are beautiful and his breath doesn't have that old cat food smell. These are great treats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves These
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these treats but my favorite thing is she actually chews them. We tried a lot of other dental treats but they were too small and she just swallowed them. She can't swallow these so she chews them at least 3 times to eat them, which has done a great job of keeping her teeth clean. The Vet was very impressed with how clean her teeth are for a 7 year old cat.
customer_reviews.author: A-D

customer_reviews.title: Something good for my cat that he loves!
customer_reviews.text: These treats are suppose to be good for the dental health of your cat. The best thing about them is that my cat loves them. I feel that these are better than standard treats and probably good to have after eating their food or other treats. My cat loves them and not only him. I have given these treats to friends with cats and their cats love them too. I recommend you try them for your cat.
customer_reviews.author: R. Steinbacher

customer_reviews.title: dental treats
customer_reviews.text: So far Patrick our cat loves these treats, trouble is, he inhales them instead of CRUNCHING them for the tartar on his teeth! He tends to bypass chewing for inhaling foods and treats. We had hoped it would be good for him dental wise. He is a BIG kitty, nearing 20 pounds. And has a large head, neck, shoulders etc. Why waste energy chewing? :-)
customer_reviews.author: GEM

customer_reviews.title: Cats love them!
customer_reviews.text: My picky eater (who is 2) loves them, though they were purchased for our almost 1 year old who has terrible breath... or should I say who had. These really do help! I don’t give them to them every day, and they still make a noticeable difference. Great product and will be stocking up again soon.
customer_reviews.author: N. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: They like them!
customer_reviews.text: We have seven cats and we go through a lot of treats. This is the first round treat I've gotten them, so I wasn't sure how they would like it. But they like the action of chasing the little balls around. I'm not sure they prefer them to Temptations or Friskies, but they definitely like them. And if they actually help clean their teeth for the same price as other treats, then I'm all for it!
customer_reviews.author: Allyse W. Lande

customer_reviews.title: Good treat
customer_reviews.text: The cats like them as a treat, do they clean teeth really? I can’t tell. Rate Scent? Really? Well they don’t stink in hand and I’m not holding one to my nose to find out. Flavor to the cats is fine, I find them a bit bland and tasting like cat food....but the cat said give it 4 stars anyway.
customer_reviews.author: James Black

customer_reviews.title: Actually Improves Cat’s Breath
customer_reviews.text: They want me to comment on the flavor of this product? My cat seems to love them and it definitely makes a marked difference in her breath. I put a piece or two in with her dry food everyday. She’ll dig around through her bowl to find them. It is a very expensive treat, but works well and the cat loves them.
customer_reviews.author: DJC

customer_reviews.title: Our cat loves these and we don't have to brush her teeth!
customer_reviews.text: We can't get these in our local stores so was very happy to find here. We feed these to our cat after dinner every night to keep her teeth and gums cleaner. She loves them and it works great. We have also bought and given her the salmon flavor. Wished they came in half this size so we could have one of each flavor on hand at a time. This container lasts a LONG time at our one cat house.
customer_reviews.author: go2garrett

customer_reviews.title: Cats love..
customer_reviews.text: Two out of three love. The hold out prefers kibble. I bought because of its purported dental benefits. The review asked how it tastes and smells. I wasn’t really sure so I asked my cats. I got a resounding meow and excited tail shaking. So I gave it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Charissa Thomas

customer_reviews.title: My cats love these.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tried these myself but all seven of my cats love these treats. My oldest cat had dental work a few years ago but her recent checkup was fine so these may be doing what they are supposed to do. For kittens less than 6 months, I cut them in half because they are big and hard.
customer_reviews.author: mayley

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your cats teeth clean and no bad breath. Can't find anywhere locally, please keep in stock.
customer_reviews.text: I have not been able to find either flavors of these dental treats anywhere. My vet is quite impressed with how clean my cats teeth are. She is now 4 years old, and I have an giving these to her since being a kitten. I was very disappointed when I could not purchase them anywhere. When I went PetsMart, they said they had been discontinued. Then to my delight, I found them on the Amazon website! I bought four (2 of each flavors). I was very happy given the price of them when they came, that it was actually a larger container then I was purchasing in the stores. So I hope you continue to carry these.
customer_reviews.author: chris mosher

customer_reviews.title: Good Price, Cat Loves
customer_reviews.text: Such a large container for the price. My cat loves these and they will be replacing her temptations! They seem to have the texture as described. Slightly larger in size than other brands but that likely helps with the cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: M. McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Finally a treat my cat “chews”.
customer_reviews.text: Normally, my cat swallows his treats WHOLE so I wasn’t sure if these would be beneficial at all. Well finally.... something he has to chew to eat so that has to be good for his teeth. I got these in 2 flavors and he loves them both. Actually, all for of my cats love them.... he’s just the only one I Initially bought them for. Haha
customer_reviews.author: Squirrelgirl

customer_reviews.title: They don’t like it.
customer_reviews.text: My cats have staged a rebellion;wont come when called, and don’t do their tricks. I think they don’t like the product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda E. McAlevey

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves them
customer_reviews.text: Cat begs for them. I have taught him tricks using these as rewards, yes it can be done. Now he knows how to "high five" for reward, he rattles the jar and then soft paw smacks me. Also taught him to use paw to get one treat out after he put his head in one time and got stuck.
customer_reviews.author: CROCGRANDMA

customer_reviews.title: What I like the most
customer_reviews.text: What I like the most: one of my cats ADORES this treat. What I like the least: The cat who adores this treat will meow loudly ever time she thinks she can get some. I keep it in my bathroom and in the morning and night there's a lot of loud meowing hopeful for some of this treat. Hopefully it is good for her teeth. Her waistline...not so much...but she has always been tubby.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these,tho the latest jar had an unusual item in it......
customer_reviews.text: I don't eat this,it's for my cat. He loves them. When I opened the jar that arrived today,I'm guessing a worker at the Purina plant took an extra label,folded it in half,and musta stuck it in the jar before it was factory sealed. Contacted Purina about this via Twitter,and they're now sending me coupons for cat treats!
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Hoyer

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes them.
customer_reviews.text: Although my cat likes them and they are for his teeth he rarely chews them he just swallows them. I would recommend they make them a little bigger so they are harder to swallow if not chewed.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Cat Loves these
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves me to throw these so she can bat them around the floor before eating them. She is very picky eater and won't eat any people food and rarely any treats. Defiantly a run shape for a cat to chase around before eating and its good for teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Elodie

customer_reviews.title: Cat won't eat them as a treat, but when ...
customer_reviews.text: Cat won't eat them as a treat, but when mixed into his regular food he will eat them. They leave crumbs all over my floor when my cat eats them, but that just might be my cat..he is small and I think they're tough for him to get through. Too early to say if they have any affect on his teeth. You get a lot for $6, so it's worth trying.
customer_reviews.author: Kaye

product_meta.title: Purina DentaLife Adult Cat Treats
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Chicken| Size:13.5 oz. CanisterMake caring for your cat's oral health a priority when you serve up Purina DentaLife Tasty Chicken Flavor adult cat dental treats. Scientifically designed to help your cat's teeth penetrate each treat, they help deliver a breakthrough clean, and their unique texture surrounds all sides of the tooth, helping to reduce tartar buildup more effectively. Each delicious dental treat contains added calcium and taurine, so you can feel good about offering these healthy cat snacks to your feline companion. She's sure to love the delicious chicken flavor and the crave-worthy crunchy texture, and you can rest easy knowing she's getting the oral care she needs to help keep her teeth and gums healthy each day. Serve these tasty Purina DentaLife adult cat treats in addition to your adult cat's complete and balanced daily diet, and give her a mouthwatering reason to show off her smile every day.
feature_bullets: One (1) 13.5 Oz. Canister Of Purina Dentalife Chicken Flavor Cat Treats
More Porous Texture Than Traditional Cat Treats To More Easily Reduce Tartar Buildup
Helps Clean All Sides Of Teeth
Scientifically Designed To Help The Tooth Penetrate The Treat To Effectively Clean Cats' Teeth
Contains No Artificial Flavors Or Colors
Should be fed as a treat to your adult cat
